column4: I am back again, with the same CD eject problem; Ubuntu simply will not eject the CD, I have just rebooted and removed the CD that was in, now I want to insert another, but cannot. any idea?
does your cd drive have a "pinhole" type thing on the cd tray?
yes it does, but I hope you are not about to suggest that I use that every time I wish to use a CD
Testic, only temporarily :)
what would you suggest I do in the future?
I would say order a new drive, sounds like the motors burned out....but..im just saying this from what I've seen in comments...im not sure I have been here for your whole conversation.
Does the drive make any noise when you press eject testic?
I am very sure the drive works, I was using it earlier in Windows, and when I rebooted I was able to eject it during the BIOS screen
no noises, no error messages displayed
Oh, well...hmmmm
im scratching my head on this one buddy, im at a loss here :(
me too, the drive worked just fine last time I booted into Ubuntu
Did you change any settins since the last time testic?
nothing at all
wow...um.
some setting somewhere got messed up somehow, but...what...heh, im trying to think of everything and I cant..
!iso | Devourer
oops, wrong one..that was for mounting not making my bad :(
thanks ompaul, I was at a loss for commands there for a sec.
heh
sudo hdparm -w /dev/hdb  has enabled me to open my CD drive, but being a noob I dont know what I have done :)
